newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: CRICKET-SCHULTZ RECALLED BY SOUTH AFRICA.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-SCHULTZ RECALLED BY SOUTH AFRICA.

text.p: South Africa have recalled left-arm fast bowler Brett Schultz to their squad for the third and final test match against Australia starting at Centurion Park on Friday.
Schultz replaces Shaun Pollock in the 13-strong party, otherwise unchanged from the one which lost the second test in Port Elizabeth on Monday to go 2-0 down in th series.
Pollock tore a hamstring bowling in Australia's first innings and was unable to take the field on Monday as Australia wrapped up victory by two wickets.
Schultz, 26, comes back into the test reckoning a year after a buttock injury at Centurion against England interrupted an injury-plagued international career.
Despite his return, Pollock's Natal team-mate Lance Klusener, left out at Port Elizabeth, is tipped to take Pollock's place in the final XI at Centurion.

Squad: Hansie Cronje (captain), Gary Kirsten, Adam Bacher, Jacques Kallis, Daryll Cullinan, Herschelle Gibbs, Brian McMillan, Dave Richardson, Lance Klusener, Allan Donald, Paul Adams, Pat Symcox, Brett Schultz.
